action.action-desc: Mr. Burchett introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish a pro bono service requirement for individuals who borrow Federal student loans for graduate legal education, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Legal Aid for Americans Act of 2022.

section.header: Pro bono service requirement for law graduates
section.text: Section 455 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087e) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Pro bono service requirement for law graduates

paragraph.text: As condition of receiving a loan under this part for graduate legal education, a borrower shall enter into an agreement with the Secretary pursuant to which the borrower agrees to perform legal work, on a pro bono basis, for not fewer than 50 hours per year during each year of the applicable service period.

subparagraph.text: On an annual basis during each year of the applicable service period, a borrower subject to an agreement under paragraph (1) shall submit to the Secretary a certification indicating whether or not the borrower has complied with the requirements of the agreement.

A borrower who is employed in a public service job (as defined in subsection (m)) during the applicable service period, as demonstrated by an annual certification of such employment submitted to the Secretary by such borrower, shall be deemed to be in compliance with the pro bono service requirement under this subsection and shall not be required to perform any additional pro bono service pursuant to this subsection.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, a borrower subject to an agreement under paragraph (1) who does not comply with the terms of the agreement for any year of the applicable service period shall be treated as in default on any loan to which such agreement applies until the date on which the borrower certifies that the borrower is in compliance with the agreement.
The requirement to perform pro bono legal service pursuant to an agreement under paragraph (1) shall not apply during any period in which the borrower—

subparagraph.text: is serving on active duty during a war or other military operation or national emergency;
is performing qualifying National Guard duty during a war or other military operation or national emergency; or
is attending an institution of higher education on not less than a half-time basis.

paragraph.text: The requirement under paragraph (1) shall apply to loans made under this part for graduate legal education after the date of enactment of the Legal Aid for Americans Act of 2022.

subparagraph.text: The term applicable service period means—

clause.text: with respect to a borrower who is licensed to practice law in a State before receiving a loan under this part for graduate legal education, the first three years following the date on which the borrower completes the program of study for which the loan was obtained; and

with respect to a borrower who is not licensed to practice law in a State before receiving a loan under this part for graduate legal education, the first three years following the date on which the borrower obtains a license to practice law in a State.

subparagraph.text: The term graduate legal education means any program of study leading to a graduate degree or graduate certificate in a legal field (as determined by the Secretary), including any program of study leading to a Juris Doctor (JD) degree, Master of Laws (LLM) degree, or Doctor of Juridical Science (SJD) degree.
